c4a44f4b0d84e0408cb928a32ed2ac07 (19:09): ello. quickie =>  I have a document.addEventListener('click',functionname,true);  functionname() gets executed fine when i just click on the page anywhere. however when I click on a <a> link it doesnt seem functionname() has enough time to process. if i put an alert("foo'); inside functionname() it works..  functionname() does a XMLHttpRequest
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (19:09): not enough time since the link is followed? isn't that what the third argument to addeventlistener controls?
c4a44f4b0d84e0408cb928a32ed2ac07 (19:10): thought so... but still doesnt seem to have enough time
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (19:10): what do you mean not enough time? what happens?
c4a44f4b0d84e0408cb928a32ed2ac07 (19:10): oh the browser follows the link and the XMLHttpRequest is not sent to the server
c4a44f4b0d84e0408cb928a32ed2ac07 (19:10): if i put a while() loop in after the httprequest it works.. but the click takes 200 milliseconds to process.. bit laggy for the user
5f167a6a2d638a86411368d3064261c1 (19:11): Is there a way to reduce de opacity of a image using javascript (with css) ?
c4a44f4b0d84e0408cb928a32ed2ac07 (19:11): i thought the 3rd argument set to true meant that it would grab and process the click before the browser took the user to the url
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (19:11): FernandoM yes, use css3 opacity for ff/op/sf and style.filter for ie
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (19:12): dtb no, the third argument controls whether the action that follows the click should occur or not
c4a44f4b0d84e0408cb928a32ed2ac07 (19:12): http://www.quirksmode.org/js/events_advanced.html
c4a44f4b0d84e0408cb928a32ed2ac07 (19:12): ........it is meant to state whether the event handler should be executed in the capturing or in the bubbling phase
c4a44f4b0d84e0408cb928a32ed2ac07 (19:13): anywho it doesnt work with true or false :-/
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (19:13): okay, i never use addeventlistener
c4a44f4b0d84e0408cb928a32ed2ac07 (19:13): i have also tried document.onclick=functionname;  and same result

c4a44f4b0d84e0408cb928a32ed2ac07 (19:18): well if i do document.onclick=func;  function func(){ var img = new Image(1,1);  img.src="foo.gif";  }   is there a way I can make the func() function hang until it has loaded the image?
c4a44f4b0d84e0408cb928a32ed2ac07 (19:18): that was if a user clicks on an <a> link it will not take the user away from the page until my image is loaded?
189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (19:19): the onload event exists for images as well
c4a44f4b0d84e0408cb928a32ed2ac07 (19:20): function func(){  var img = new Image(1,1);  img.src="foo.gif";  img.onLoad=return but until then wait; }

d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (19:58): Hey there, I've made a forum that looks like http://www.mfp.co.il/forum/ (tree forum). I want to save which messages were readen by who, so the next time they join they already see the readen messages marked.
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (19:59): Nothing to do with server side. How to store this data with JS?
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (19:59): well cookies would be your best bet
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (19:59): How much can a cookie contain?
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (19:59): although a more reliable way is storing the info server side :P
a06799ba5c7fbc1cd9f0fe0c683c6ee2 (20:00): 4 KB?  32 KB?
a06799ba5c7fbc1cd9f0fe0c683c6ee2 (20:00): Depends on the browser, AFAIK.
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:00): generally i'd say its not worth using a cookie cause they can be deleted easily etc thus you lose track
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:00): Hm.. storing all this info server side would kill my server ^^
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:00): just store their last login date
938a02745d9ebfe01498522fc54bcc67 (20:00): Q: how come if i do 'with(ele) { onclick = foo }' it doesnt work but 'ele.onclick = foo' does work ? :{
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:00): and show all messages since that date as unread
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:00): with maybe a temp value for ones they then read
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:00): Naa. I want to display all the messages :)
a06799ba5c7fbc1cd9f0fe0c683c6ee2 (20:01): mexicaan: `with` is dangeruos.
a06799ba5c7fbc1cd9f0fe0c683c6ee2 (20:01): Dangerous, even.
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:01): I thought of userdata but it won't work in FF.
a06799ba5c7fbc1cd9f0fe0c683c6ee2 (20:01): You are advised not to use it.
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:01): as i said RedNinja-, your best bet is storing server-side
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:01): what kind of server/traffic do yuo have where that would kill it :P
938a02745d9ebfe01498522fc54bcc67 (20:01): Aankhen``: developer.mozilla.org doesnt think its so bad
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:02): It's not about the servers, lets say around 1 million messages and 100,000 users
938a02745d9ebfe01498522fc54bcc67 (20:02): doesnt answer my question though :{
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:02): It's a lot to save :p
a06799ba5c7fbc1cd9f0fe0c683c6ee2 (20:02): mexicaan: ...okay, go ahead and use it. You already saw it can cause problems.
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:02): Let's ask it this way - what would be the best client-side option, without cookies/userData (if it's possible)

189edbf28f3da1f5bf29efe53c42687b (20:02): mexicaan the thing about with is, that it's extremely unreliable when assigning new members, you essentially have no clue where the property will end up unless it's already defined in ele
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:02): RedNinja-
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:02): what kind of time frame do you expect to have that many users?
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:03): What do you mean by time frame? when will I have this user count?
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:03): and 1 million messages per 100k users is probably a bit of an underestimate
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:03): I mean there are about 100,000 users per day (returning ones)
938a02745d9ebfe01498522fc54bcc67 (20:03): fine, ill convert all my with()'s :{
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:03): And currently there are 1 million messages

d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:04): It's an upgrade for a system
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:04): Yes, it's not for the site I gave the link for, this is just the consept :)
c147c861244b4bc3b1ec5213c25bfc75 (20:04): RedNinja, activeX?
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:04): fair enough ^.^ was just checking you weren't someone being overly starry-eyed
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:04): might be worth downloading something like phpbb and seeing how they do it
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:04): Not much would install an antivex controller for it, I'm afraid.
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:05): or errrrm, vbulletien *Shrugs*
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:05): It's different there, as they only mark if the "thread" was readen, not per message.
c147c861244b4bc3b1ec5213c25bfc75 (20:05): k, with that you could write a text file on client HDD
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:05): a per-message one you are i think looking at a lot of data storage
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:05): you say there an example of 1 million messages
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:05): say you have a few characters stored per message
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:05): Yes but you won't read all the 1 million messages :p
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:05): how many do you expect users will tend to read daily on average?
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:06): Let's say.. Really hard to say
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:06): Let's think of another thing
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:06): If I save in cookie the messages that were readen only in the last three days,
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:06): Sounds reasonable?
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:08): say 15 bytes/message
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:08): 1k/day storage
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:08): gives a good amount of messages really
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:09): might wanna check max cookie sizes but if you just store id's of read messages that would probably work
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:09): ID's only of course :)
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:09): when you come to search there though for read messages is the fun bit
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:09): Ok, so this is solved. Now I have in the cookie something like 1654,5564,1548,1354,1879
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:10): Oh, nvm. I think it's ok
75a75afe65961688e8423dec6ade51e3 (20:10): i'd have expected at least 10 or so :)
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:10): Well, it's just an example as I said
d83e11907474835badd99f9f8ea1a881 (20:10): I haven't ctually started storing cookies yet
